column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$4$3$I went through a period of sycosis from end of January 2011 - March or April 2011. Except for I had lost some wieght then gained 20 lbs back and I am making alot of the hormone that you have when you are pregnant but am not pregnant. That causes me to produce milk. column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"I was diagnosed with ""schizophrenia"" at the age of 35
column3: so quite late. Invega (6mg) makes the voices in my head completely disappear or preventing them. Besides
column4: bizarre delusions
column5: like equipment that can read your mind
column6: are eliminated. Taking Invega gives you a calm mind
column7: thoughts don't ramble. Furthermore angry feelings  are decreased. Because of the gradually and continuous release of the medicine (new release system)
column8: one doesn't feel a drug boost - drugged. Now the side-effects : I need more sleep
column10: less fit. Taking Invega for the first time might give you nightmares. And you might drool when you get higher doses. Sometimes a light headache can occur more frequently. When you stop with Invega (or Risperdal) I experienced a little bit of strange movements with tongue/mouth/jaws. This stopped after a few months. And I think I got heartburn (reflux problems) from it. Invega is very effective diminishing the positive symptoms. But I'm not sure about it
column11: when it comes to negative symptoms. Invega makes me lazy
column12: and less motivated - indifferent. I'm not sure about the following fact
column13: but I think it's true : Risperdal gave me a bit of depersonalized feeling (increased it) - like there was a (virtual glass) barrier between me and the outside world (""cloud"" in my head). Invega
column15: but didn't gave me that depersonalization / derealization feeling at all!! I don't feel completely OK yet
column16: but for now Invega provides me with the means to manage my life quite well
column17: without help from other people. 3 mg Invega as maintenance dose is still quite effective. I still long for a complete recovery
column18: although extremely rare when one has schizophrenia. "

column1: 147$Schizophrenia$7/8/2008 8:15:26 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$"Because of drug abuse as a teen I developed audio hallucinations.  I was put on a drug called Serentil and was on it for over 25 years. I took 50mg per day. I was fine all my adult life then they stopped making the drug.  I tried everything-Geodon-Seroquel-Resperdal-Melleril and others.  Nothing worked.  Finally I changed docs and he put me on Invega-3mg-didn't work then 6mg-better but still not the best then 9mg-great.  No more voices and I don't have any side effects.  Only problem is over the 3 years of trying different meds I developed constant anxiety. My doc put me on Xanax ER.  Which may not be the best for someone who used to use drugs but
column2: I haven't used since age 20 and I'm 47 now.  No side effects with Xanax ER either. And I still have slight anxiety but
column3: I live with it.  As for the weight gain  on Invega I don't have it but
column4: I have a very physical job so that may have something to do with it.  I also tried Depakote and gained 25# in 2 months.  The most important thing is no voices and I can live a ""normal"" life.  After 3 years of trying Thank God for Invega."

204$Schizophrenia$7/27/2015 3:33:02 AM$Reviewer: 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver) $1$1$4$This med can be a living hell for some people.  My adult son was like a caged animal on this stuff.  He would scream, hit his head with his fist, and kick holes in the wall.  His hallucinations were so creepy that he frightened me.  Every time I'd tell the doctor how awful it was, she'd say he needs to take the next dose, then the next.  He took it 6 months.  It was the most horrible six months of our lives, not to mention all the damage done to my home.  In case you might wonder, he was not using illegal drugs and not drinking alcohol.  We recently had testing through an orthomolecular Dr and learned that my son is under methylated (high histamine) and zinc deficient.  Don't know if that had anything to do with his problem on this med.  None of the meds have worked for him, but Invega Sustenna was absolutely the worst.

206$Schizophrenia$4/9/2015 9:44:44 PM$Reviewer: elise, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver) $4$5$5$My 18 year old son was diagnosed with schizophrenia about a year ago. It has been a really rough ride. He has tried a lot of drugs and even this one once before. As the dosage was lowered he got worse and the voices never left anyway,so we tried other drugs. Recently we came back to this one after I read a review on this site that one reviewer's voices didn't leave until after 5 months of use. I was hopeful to try it again. And sure enough between 5-6 months the voices stopped all of a sudden! He still talks to himself a lot, but says he is just used to doing so. He watches tv and plays video games, and goes out in public more. He also takes Cogentin, which helps with eye muscle spasms which started on some of the other drugs, so he just stayed on it. Overall, I am pleased with this drug. He is taking the 234 injection every 3 weeks.

231$Schizophrenia$7/25/2012 10:48:43 AM$Reviewer: Kelly92675, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$3$5$I took the pill for 3 years before the injections.  They didnt work because I always forgot to take them and so I constantly was in and out of Psychotic episodes. Felt a difference after the first injection. The voices began to quiet. Was very sleepy in the beginning. And moody, but not raging. Mellowed out over a few months. The facial twitches and personality glitches started to fade away. I was able to interact with my family again and now have a great relationship with them that I cherish. I love my kids and am learning to function as a mother and a provider for the first time on my own in a safe an loving way. This drug truely has saved my life and the well being of my children and their upbringing. Unfortunately it has come with a price. I have gained 76 pounds in 7 months. My thyroid is effected. I have abnormal heart electrical signals. High blood sugar. I stop breathing in my sleep. I have constant swelling on the arms legs and feet. I look like Im 8 months pregnant. I sweat and am constantly hot and dehydrated. I get hives and skin rashes all the time. My face is swollen and puffy. My vision is blurry and I cant hardly taste my food. Seems the side effects are piling up faster and faster lately and Im totally bummed out about it. Im suffering through them because I have tried literally dozens of other medications that havent worked at all and this is the best I have found. For those that havent tried it, you should. Its great. Its peace of mind for those who havent had it. And a chance at normalcy. For now, the side effects wont stop me from continuing to take it. Im seeing a specialist to help. Ill keep you updated on if there is resulution. Its the best I have found in 20 years.
233$Schizophrenia$6/3/2012 12:54:35 AM$Reviewer: Taylor, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$This medicine has worked great for me.  Before getting on this drug, I was very psychotic and nothing was helping.  Then when I started this I could tell a little difference, but after being on it for 5 months I'm experiencing hardly any symptoms and I'm feeling normal.  This has been a great drug for me.  When I first started using it I was very sleepy, but now I only get sleepy the day I get my shot, after that I'm good.
234$Schizophrenia$5/3/2012 9:25:34 PM$Reviewer: Bill, 55-64 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$My experience with Invega began with the pills. After trying other drugs I found the pills are fantastic in making one feel alert during the day. These are slow release tabs so you may have to take a sleeping pill to get to sleep. Now I've been taking the injections for two years. The first six months it takes a little more effort to stay awake during the day though with me this day sleepy feeling decreased. However I can still take day nap though the main reason for that is simply being bored in that I'd rather take a nap than stay awake. Night sleep is normal and you probably won't need a sleeping pill. On doses the first day seems the same as the last and there are no extreme highs or lows. I take the 117 dose. When considering the alternatives there is no other drug I'd rather be taking. Lucky for me with my insurance I can get three doses for $125."

column1: 246$Schizophrenia$6/2/2011 9:46:43 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$5$5$I am 24 years old and am finally able to go back to school and go to work. column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$I only get this shot once a month.  It has saved my life.  The voices are quieter now and I have a job and I'm taking college classes online.  I don't have to take two of my pills anymore either.
55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $5$5$5$MY SON HAS BEEN ON SEVERAL AND THIS LAST ONE LOWERED HIS WHITE CELLS CONSIDERABLY
column3: CLOZAPINE. WILL SEE THE DR.IN 2 DAYS AND IN THE MEANTIME HE WILL BE ON TRAZADONE WHICH DIDNT HELP HIM SLEEP AND DAPAKOTE.  I LOOKED THIS MED UP AND IT SEEMS IT WILL WORK.  I WILL WRITE A COMMENT AS HE TAKES IT IF THE DR. AGREES.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver) $5$4$5$"My son is on this medication for schizophrenia.

column1: My son has been on this shot for about 9 months now and it has helped his symptoms considerably; he is more communicative and is resting better on this medication than any other he has tried recently. He is also on lithium as well. He still talks to himself some and paces around the house at times but considering how poorly he was doing on some of the other meds it’s a major improvement. He is able to set down and enjoy watching a little TV or play video games now where he wasn’t before this medicine. Be careful with any of these meds and good luck.
256$Schizophrenia$10/18/2010 12:00:48 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver) $4$5$5$Hi-

I am the mother of a 20 year old son on Invega Sustenna IM for 6 months.  He has not had any weight gain but he is more sleepy.  The drug has dramaticly lowered the voices but has not eliminated them all together.  The mood swings are reduced significantly but don't forget he is still a young adult.
I as the care taker love the once a month injection.  I am no longer concerned with him being compliant with his medication.
As a care taker I highly recommend this medication.  It is expensive but Medicaid does pay for it.

column2: 35-44 Male  (Patient) $4$5$5$I am so much better off now that I am on this drug. People have noticed a big difference. I have too.

25-34 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$3$4$I had previously been on sustenna (1 month injection) for about 3 years when I switched to trinza (3 month injection) as soon as it was available. I've been on the trinza formulation for about a year. I'm happy with symptom control (no longer anger problems from paranoia etc.).  However
column3: I do still have anxiety episodes about twice a week (thoughts of harm to self and others).

column1: 264$Schizophrenia$3/21/2019 10:15:15 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver) $2$2$4$My son did great on Invega Sustenna for 7 months

column3: it seems to have worn off after about a month and a half

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver) $4$1$5$My mother who is 69 has been on this for about a year and a half. She started having extreme side effects
column3: muscle tremors
column4: involuntary muscle movement
column8: not being able to open a water bottle or any kind of bottle. I thought she had early signs of dementia no it was invega trenza. So upset it worked for her and the injections we're so convenient if you know anyone schizophrenic it's so hard to get them to take their medicine. I took her off the injection myself. It's not worth it she wasn't even driving anymore she forgot how and didn't have the motor skills to drive a stick or the muscle strength. The Dr now says it could take 4 months for side effects to get out of her system or they can just be permanent now. What kind of life is this for her and I the one that takes care of her. She's on a medicine that is for side effects from Parkinson's disease and that's helping her. Hopefully it's not permanent. There has to be some other way. She's worse off now than when she was having schizo symptoms. Now do we have to deal with all that and hallucinations

column2: 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"I've been on Paliperidone for about a month now and I was scared by other reviews about weight gain and other crazy side effects. column3: but it wasn't effective until I got up to 9 mg. I have Schizoaffective disorder. This is the only medication that I feel is helping me cope. It was also a last resort because I've been on all of the old ""typical"" antipsychotics and the new ""atypicals."""

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$While taking 6mg of this drug I was doing very well until stress in my life happened and I started to become very paranoid again and have extremely intrusive and bizarre thoughts. Was switched to 9mg and the thoughts and my attitude have drastically been affected positively. I also take zyprexa (low dose)
column3: I have not seen any weight gain from Invega. Invega makes me very drowsy initially after taking the pill so I take it at nighttime. Underlying drowsiness throughout the day. I am able to go to college and do all my work well. Do not feel like a zombie like on other anti-psychotics. Has been a good experience for me. Earned a 3.7 GPA last semester in upper-division classes.

35-44 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $1$1$1$I lay in bed for 20 hours a day and care about nothing. I don't even want to get up and cook or eat. I do though
column3: and have gained 50  pounds. This drug has been a nightmare for me and I'm stopping it next month. I just hope I can get my life back afterwards. Depression has been a big issue and I feel dead. I don't see how anyone else can tolerate being on this medication. In the beginning it was not bad
column4: but the side effects just kept on getting worse and worse. Today I'm a shell of my former self. Id rather have hallucinations and delusions than live like a zombie. If I was forced to take this medication then I'd rather be dead. I will quit cold turkey next month and I expect a wild ride. Maybe some day ill experience happiness again. Until then

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$3$5$So far so good.  So many negative reviews
column3: I’m assuming these people probably haven’t lived with Schizophrenia and are probably misdiagnosed because I’d give my left arm to finally feel like a functional part of society again.  It’s only been a week o The injection and after the initial pain of the injection sites subsided I felt and increase in hunger thirst restlessness and insomnia or lack there of. There is pain at the injection site a few days after the injection but after that pain subsides and get back to feeling normal within about five days Still fighting every day with delusions and regular schizophrenic things that tend to happen with schizophrenia but I am starting to realize that not all of them are actually real I’m starting to finally feel like the cloud is been lifted and I can finally differentiate between what is real and what is imagined.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$2$3$Had first shot about 3 days ago.   Shot didn’t hurt and was fine alll day.  Day 2: arm really hurt and I only got 2 hours of sleep Day3: arm super hurt and am very sleepy
column3: groggy and dozzy

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $4$4$4$"I am posting this as a caregiver.  I don't take this medication but
column3: my teen daughter does.  She just started taking it two days ago and I am slowly seeing results she still paces a bit but
column4: very sleepy at times and seemed very sad/pouty for about 5 minutes and came back to being ok after I reassured her and hugged her.  They are taking her off some of her oral medications as she slowly adjusts to the injections.  The only thing is that she seems to have an extra healthy appetite but
column5: if the voices go away or diminish substantially then it will be worth it.  I just have to keep her active in the meantime.  I don't let her mope around I will invent any reason I can think of to get her out of the house.  My only current concern is that she seems more like swollen than anything not fat but swollen.  I hope they come up with an inverna injection that does not cause any weight gain because that would make a young teen or any person truly happier and more active.  Before all this meds my daughter was 105lbs and now she is about 140lbs. she is 5ft 4in tall.  My daughter just turned 18.

column1: Question 4 should have the option to differentiate between the patient and caregiver personal stats information.  I hope the government gives more money for more research on mental illness.  It seems that mental illness is the stepchild illness when it comes to overall funding.  This and denial on the part of some families due to fear of stigmatizing their loved one has created an epidemic and its time we let go of that nonsense and talk openly about mental illness.  There is nothing to be ashamed of if you or someone in your family has mental illness of any kind. "
